Sections.Text: September 17, 1943. The Tyree Trust uses wartime research funding to try and develop an American countermeasure to combat German Thulekraft occult operatives.
Sir Willhelm Bohn, on loan from Her Majesty's Government, is the undisputed genius of the operation and has done groundbreaking work in weaponizing spiritual assets.
Unfortunately, Professor Keith Evans doesn't agree with Bohn's assessment, and has spent his whole time complaining and undermining Bohn's authority.
Both agree on only one thing - their best hope for success lies in reactivating the recently-excavated Golem, created by Cornelius Bosch.
In his haste, Prof. Evans has decided to make a deal with the more dangerous denizens that have lain sealed away beneath the museum for study.
Sir Bohn would have been more cautious in engaging in negotiations with these four powerful and dangerous supernaturals, but the War Department listened to Evans.
But he will be damned if he'll let that fool Evans handle the negotiations. Sir Bohn knows how to handle such matters properly.
Each supernatural entity can summon up lesser beings and use their occult essences to power the Golem.
Evans will know doubt be pestering the entities as well, but Bohn's calculations say he only needs two supernaturals to agree to his terms.
Of course knowing Evans, he will probably try to recruit two of his own allies so that he can steal all the credit for the Trust's research.
